Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Conflict_Reason: Achieving high fuel efficiency and high top speed are often conflicting goals in engine design; increasing power for higher speed usually compromises fuel economy.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: Higher fuel efficiency often requires more expensive engine components and increased maintenance, conflicting with the low annual maintenance cost target.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Improving fuel efficiency often necessitates heavier engine components, conflicting with the lightweight frame requirement.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Electric motor with a minimum range of 120 km per charge
Conflict_Reason: Increased braking power from ABS necessitates higher energy consumption, potentially reducing the electric motor's range.

Requirement_1: Fuel efficiency of at least 60 km/l for petrol engines
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Increasing fuel efficiency often necessitates design choices that may conflict with emission reduction strategies, requiring careful optimization across multiple design parameters.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Conflict_Reason: Increasing braking power (ABS) often necessitates compromises in vehicle weight and/or powertrain efficiency, potentially conflicting with the high-speed requirement.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity
Conflict_Reason: Requirement 1 (ABS) demands high real-time processing power and interrupt priority, potentially conflicting with Requirement 2 (digital dashboard) for MCU resources and processing time.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Increased braking system mass for ABS functionality conflicts with the lightweight frame requirement, necessitating optimization and potential compromises in design.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: High-performance ABS systems necessitate sophisticated sensors, actuators, and control algorithms, increasing initial cost and potentially long-term maintenance expenses, conflicting with the low annual maintenance budget.

Requirement_1: Anti-lock braking system (ABS) for improved stopping power
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Improving braking power (Requirement 1) often necessitates more complex and power-hungry ABS systems, potentially conflicting with stringent emission standards (Requirement 2) that demand efficient energy management.

Requirement_1: Electric motor with a minimum range of 120 km per charge
Requirement_2: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Conflict_Reason: Achieving a 120km range and a 100km/h top speed requires a tradeoff in battery capacity, motor power, and vehicle aerodynamics, potentially leading to increased weight, cost, and/or reduced efficiency.

Requirement_1: Electric motor with a minimum range of 120 km per charge
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Increased battery capacity for extended range conflicts with the need for a lightweight frame, requiring careful design optimization to balance these competing objectives.

Requirement_1: Electric motor with a minimum range of 120 km per charge
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: Achieving a 120km range requires a larger, more powerful motor and battery, increasing initial and maintenance costs, conflicting with the $120 annual maintenance budget.

Requirement_1: Electric motor with a minimum range of 120 km per charge
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Increasing motor range often necessitates a larger battery, impacting vehicle weight and potentially conflicting with emission standards aiming for fuel efficiency and reduced emissions.

Requirement_1: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: Higher top speed necessitates more powerful (and likely more expensive to maintain)  mechanical and electrical components, conflicting with the low annual maintenance cost target.

Requirement_1: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Achieving high speed necessitates a powerful motor and robust drivetrain, increasing weight, conflicting with the lightweight frame requirement.

Requirement_1: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Requirement_2: Digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity
Conflict_Reason: Requirement 1 prioritizes high speed requiring significant power and potentially impacting battery life, conflicting with Requirement 2's demand for power-consuming smartphone connectivity features in the digital dashboard.

Requirement_1: Top speed of at least 100 km/h for versatility
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Achieving a top speed of 100 km/h may conflict with meeting stringent emission standards, requiring a trade-off between performance and environmental impact in the engine design.

Requirement_1: Seat height adjustable between 750-850 mm for rider comfort
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: Requirement 1 (seat height adjustment mechanism) increases manufacturing complexity and maintenance needs, potentially exceeding the $120 annual maintenance budget in Requirement 2.

Requirement_1: Seat height adjustable between 750-850 mm for rider comfort
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Increased structural rigidity needed for wider seat height adjustment range conflicts with the lightweight frame requirement.

Requirement_1: Digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Smartphone connectivity adds complexity and power consumption, potentially conflicting with emission reduction goals.

Requirement_1: Digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: Smartphone connectivity necessitates hardware (e.g., Bluetooth module, cellular modem) and potentially recurring software updates increasing maintenance cost beyond the $120 limit.

Requirement_1: Digital dashboard with smartphone connectivity
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Achieving smartphone connectivity necessitates additional hardware (e.g., communication modules, antennas) increasing the overall weight, potentially exceeding the 150kg weight limit.

Requirement_1: Front and rear disc brakes for reliable performance
Requirement_2: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Conflict_Reason: High-performance disc brakes for both front and rear generally imply higher initial cost and more frequent/expensive maintenance than simpler brake systems, potentially exceeding the $120 annual budget.

Requirement_1: Front and rear disc brakes for reliable performance
Requirement_2: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Conflict_Reason: Increased braking system mass from disc brakes conflicts with the lightweight frame requirement, necessitating a design compromise between braking performance and vehicle weight.

Requirement_1: Annual maintenance cost below $120
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Meeting stringent emission standards (Requirement 2) often necessitates advanced emission control technologies, which generally increase maintenance costs beyond the $120 annual budget (Requirement 1).

Requirement_1: Lightweight frame under 150 kg for better handling
Requirement_2: Compliance with global emission standards (e.g., BS6 or Euro 5)
Conflict_Reason: Lighter frame reduces weight, potentially impacting structural rigidity and thus the ability to meet emission standards by affecting exhaust system design and engine mounting.
